Package pieces

Class King

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.King
public class King
extends Piece
King is a subclass of the abstract Piece class and King.java provides the implementation needed for a king chess piece

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.HashMap<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>,​Piece> map
    hashmap that contains a list of indices the king could possibly move to on the board and if these positions are mapped to a piece that means the king cannot move there

    Fields inherited from class pieces.Piece

    columnMappings, rowMappings

  • Field Details

    • map

      public java.util.HashMap<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>,​Piece> map
      hashmap that contains a list of indices the king could possibly move to on the board and if these positions are mapped to a piece that means the king cannot move there

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove​(Board board, java.lang.String move)
      validMove checks if the move made by a player can be made
      Specified by:
      validMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      move - the input of the player containing the current position of the piece as well as the end position
      Returns:
      true if the move inputted by the used is a valid move

    • whiteKingSideCastle

      public boolean whiteKingSideCastle​(Board board, int startRank, int startFile, int endRank, int endFile)
      whiteKingSideCastle checks if both the white king and the white king's side rook haven't moved and if a castle between them is possible. If it is the method will complete the move.
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      startRank - the row of the current position of the piece
      startFile - the column of the current position of the piece
      endRank - the row of the desired position
      endFile - the column of the desired position
      Returns:
      true if there are no pieces in the path

    • blackKingSideCastle

      public boolean blackKingSideCastle​(Board board, int startRank, int startFile, int endRank, int endFile)
      blackKingSideCastle checks if both the black king and the black king's side rook haven't moved and if a castle between them is possible. If it is the method will complete the move.
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      startRank - the row of the current position of the piece
      startFile - the column of the current position of the piece
      endRank - the row of the desired position
      endFile - the column of the desired position
      Returns:
      true if there are no pieces in the path

    • whiteQueenSideCastle

      public boolean whiteQueenSideCastle​(Board board, int startRank, int startFile, int endRank, int endFile)
      whiteQueenSideCastle checks if both the white king and the white queen's side rook haven't moved and if a castle between them is possible. If it is the method will complete the move.
      Parameters:

      startRank - the row of the current position of the piece

      endRank - the row of the desired position

    • isKingInCheck

      public boolean isKingInCheck​(Board board)
      isKingINCheck returns whether this king is in check
      Specified by:
      isKingInCheck in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      Returns:
      True if this king is in check.

    • simulateKingRadius

      public void simulateKingRadius​(Board board)
      simulateKingRadius essentially moves the king to a square on the board. The purpose of this method is to see when a king is in check, if it is able to move to other squares. This method will check whether surrounding squares are valid. If not, the square's coordinates will be mapped to the opposing player's piece that can kill it.
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on

    • generateKeys

      public void generateKeys​(Board board, King king)
      generateKeys() creates the initial hashmap of possibilities where king could move. This is different in that it also takes a refernece to the King object you're looking at.
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      king - King object.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      toString gets the name of the piece
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      name of piece
